Reviews.title: This is 1000% better than what I had
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019
Reviews.text:
I had an AMD card that came with my "gaming computer" and it was made in like 2015/16 and needless to say I had the computer about 2 months before I got a lovely green screen and it kept saying can't load GPU. I tried to update the graphics and well the card sucked. So my friend Jason and I were on the hunt for a new video card. I prefer Nvidia cards over AMD and have for over 2 decades now. We looked at several options compared cards, prices, options. There was the card he has that was made in 2016 then this one. This card is a beast. Since I use my computer to not only game but to live stream gaming and video content, I also edit YouTube videos and live stream on YouTube as well. This card is amazing and 1000 % better than what I had. It was super easy to install and I love it had little "hats" over all of the ports and edges so as to not allow dust or fingerprints on the green board. The listing does say it comes with an Install cd which is does not. They need to edit their listing as it is misleading.

How to install, make sure your computer is turned off, install the card, then turn it on. Once your pc loads go to your control panel and click Hardware and Sound then click Device manager, use the search feature on there to "find" your new equipment if it did not pop up as the plug and play feature when you turn your machine on. Once you find it, it will ask if you want to install the best drivers, it will do the rest for you. No install CD necessary. Super easy to install, super easy to set up, works amazing!

Reviews.title: Good Buy
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
Reviews.text:
ok i was looking for the best of the best on the cheat to play all the modern games. My husband is a pc builder but will describe it in the easiest way possible.
Specs first . CPU i5-9600K Unlocked, 16 GB of Ram, regular sata 40 bucks 1 TB hard drive from WD, Z390 AORUS ELITE(rev 1.0) and last the MSI GTX 1650.

Basically on the lower budget build but all new part gave us all new title games on high with 1 setup and high with 1 or 2 things turned off.
No matter what the data says on paper or these app monitors you have showing Frams-Per-Second
The fact is it plays Ark survival a very demanding ram and graphic hog game, Fortnite, Call of Duty-Warfare, and Battle field 5 all with everything turned up and no hick ups. Turn 1 thing or 2 down for more FPS optional at 16 Gigs of Ram.

Set up 2 is My husband put 32 GB of Ram before splitting it with other pc just to test the new GTX 1650 at its finest and just like always proves more ram equals better gaming. All setting in every game at highest nothing turned down , no glitch no stutter, smooth sailing.

Its was a great Buy, would recommend to all. Just add more Ram than needed from recommended spec games the ultra sweet spot is 32gigs, ebay Ram $114 (32GB Kit) to G.SKILL TridentZ RGB Series 32GB (2 x 16GB) at $139.99 as of 1/10/20 Add a GTX 1650 and CPU 4 cores and higher ( I5-9600k cheap 6 Cores 6 Threads ) and there would be no game you cant handle

Reviews.title: Home Theater / Spare gaming PC for guests
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019
Reviews.text:
I found spare parts lying around and pieced together a build with this and a Ryzen R5 1600 on a B350 motherboard. Powering this is a 500w power supply. I initially was going to buy a GAMING X GTX 1050 Ti, but this is cheaper and will perform a little better with games

Back to the video card.
TDP is fairly low compared to AMD alternatives at this price point. However the RX 570 would do better in gaming but draws more power.

This card is fairly cool and even after playing APEX LEGENDS for 5 hours straight this card did not go over 60C. (I do have a fairly big case with good airflow, so your miles may vary).

With regards to looks, you'll love it or hate it. The shroud is a gunmetalish gray/silver. A good color that can blend in with any build. I DO NOT LIKE THE PCB's look though. I know this is a "cheaper" card with no faceplate and that is fine. But they printed the MSI DRAGON on the PCB in the corner of this card. I mean if you like that it is fine, but for me it's an eyesore to see that printed in white onthe corner of a PCB. Anyways it is what it is and I can always just choose not to look at it so that's fine.

After testing I've determined this card will serve well for a spare gaming PC. If you're on a budget this will serve you well if you need to "go green" or want to have a cooler card with a lower power draw. If all you want is RAW GAMING POWER at a budget I'd recommend looking for a good deal on AMD RX 570/580.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2019
Reviews.text: I used to lease my GPU's from CuttingEdgeGamer, but I am going to returning my card from them to save some money in the long run and I cannot afford a super fancy card right now, so I needed something temporary. Meet the GTX 1650: kind of like The Little Engine that Could. Sure, this card won't blow your socks off with 60+ FPS on every game, but if you aren't needing or expecting that then I believe this card is a pretty good choice for either people on a tight budget or people who only play some older titles. I took a star off because I believe this card should be 15 or 20 dollars cheaper. I think it's a good value, but if they dropped the price a bit it would really be worth it. The biggest pro is that it runs cool and quiet. Even at full load for a while it doesn't really go above 60c and it draws very little power. It runs most of my games at high settings ~45 - 60 FPS and I haven't had any issues with it. I recommend this card if you are the right audience for it.

Reviews.title: Great Card Only 1 Hiccup
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019
Reviews.text:
I received my card on Monday (12/16/2019) and it works amazing! It runs all my favorite games at the highest graphic settings at 50-60 FPS, some games such as fortnite and cities skylines are still running 45-60 FPS at high settings (not the highest, but just below very high or sometimes known as "ultra". It has amazing performance, even under complete load didn't surpass 65 degrees C, which is warm, not hot (70-80 degrees C) and not even close to overheating (90+ degrees C).

Amazing card overall, it was just very tedious to get the card working. It originally put me into a BSOD booting loop until I took the card out of my PC booted into windows normally, and used a third-party program to completely remove all traces of graphic drives so I could boot up with my new card and have windows automatically install all drivers without conflict of additional programs and data.

Reviews.title: Just what my photography software need
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
Reviews.text: Recently started using AI software for some of my photos. The software taxed the original graphics card so it took forever to show the AI manipulated photo or it came out all black. Software techperson said it was the old graphics card and an upgrade was needed for the AI. My computer guy recommended this when told about the issue and it works like a charm. It's in a ThinkCentre M93p (the big box), but because of the MSI GEForce's size and motherboard pins for the PC's from USB3's they had to be disconnected.But everything, other than the USB's in the case's front, works great!

Reviews.title: Good card for the money, but doesn't last long.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020
Reviews.text: I bought this card on 20 Dec, 2019. The card is great for as cheap as it is. It worked great until today, 12 Dec 2020. Not even a full year and it died. I still gave it a 4 star because it is a great card, but be sure to buy the 2 year warranty.

Reviews.title: GeForce GTX 1650. Great bargain priced gaming card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020
Reviews.text: I waited years for Red Dead Redemption 2 to come to PC. When it finally did I was disappointed to find that my GTX 960 graphics card would only run the game at the very lowest settings. A title known for its beauty looked pretty awful. This card changed things dramatically at a very reasonable price. It’s now everything I had heard it was and I get butter smooth 40 to 50 FPS. Not the best I know but for the price I am very pleased. I would recommend it to anyone who can’t or won’t pay for the high end cards.

Perfect for mining RTX 3060's that need a x8 PCIE lane. Pictured I have 3 extenders installed with 1 3060 on the board currently. I'm currently getting a little under 200 mh/s Ethash at around 400 watts on this rig.

Paid a little over $20 for each cable, which is far better than the $30 - $40 others charge, like Thermaltake. Also, the ribbon is 300mm long! That's way better than the normal 200mm you get on other extenders.

I'm for sure going to get additional ones as needed.

Do take care when bending the cable if you are installing it within a smaller itx case that needs a 180 degree angle, as doing so too close to the ends may result in the cable sheath sliding away. Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in France on December 31, 2020
Reviews.text: dommage que le cd d installation ne soit pas fournie

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Japan on June 25, 2020
Reviews.text:
WQHDで165Hz駆動するモニターを持っておりRYZEN3 3200Gではブラウザ程度でも165Hz駆動させるのにパワーが足らないのでモニター用に購入。
元々RADEON RX460を持っていてFluid Motionがとても気に入っていたので、5500XTでより力強くなるだろうと思い購入したのだが大失敗。
5500XTにはFluid Motionが無い、どういうことなの???
GTX1650と比較すると価格と消費電力で劣りゲーム性能もベンチマークの結果を見る限り同等では5500XTを選ぶ価値があるのだろうか?

OS : WINDOWS 10 ver.1909
CPU : RYZEN5 3500
M/B : ASROCK B450 STEEL LEGEND
メモリ : DDR4-3200 8GB x2
Cドライブ : XPG ASX8200PNP-256GT-C

この仕様環境で問題なく稼働、GPU自体やRADEON Softwareで不具合が出たことは無い。
ブラウザ程度ならモニターが165Hz駆動でもほぼかくつかない、動画だとGPU使用率はだいたい25%となりMPC-BEでmadVRを使用したH265でも問題なく動く。
連続早送りは物にもよるが少し飛び飛びながらコマ送りのように画像が表示される、3200Gの場合は連続早送りでコマ送りのようにはならないのだがでもこれはたぶんCPUの性能の方が重要な気がする。
FFXVベンチマークだと標準設定で6796の快適判定となる、3200Gの内蔵APUのみだと1561で動作困難となってしまうが3200G + 5500XTだと6603で快適判定となる。
だが実際はたびたび一瞬止まる事があり弱いCPUに5500XTを乗せただけでは快適なゲーム環境とはならないのだろう。
ゲームだとBIOHAZARD RE:3でスタートから地下鉄までのパフォーマンスを測定。
初期設定のままで解像度はフルHD 120Hzに設定した場合、上が114FPSで下は73FPS程度となり平均は80FPSとなった。
60FPSを下回ることが無くこれならPS4よりも性能が良いと言えるだろう、ただし解像度をWQHD 120Hzに設定した場合処理落ちでかなりかくついていた。

このGPUはモニター次第だといえる、ゲームでもフルHD環境でなら高リフレッシュレートのモニターでも全く問題は無いが4KやWQHDでの使用となると快適な環境になるとは言えないだろう。
なのでフルHD以上の解像度のモニターを買う予定が無くPCでゲームをしたいと言うのなら

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Japan on November 7, 2020
Reviews.text:
mac miniのグラボとして購入。
一発で問題なく動作して非常に満足。
バージョンは10.15.6以降である必要があるらしい。

静音性が非常に高く、全く気にならない。
Windows接続のRTX 2070と比較しても全く音が気にならなく素晴らしい。
エンコード時などの高負荷時はファンがよく回るが、4K + FHDx2 + UltraWide 4画面でも一切音がしない。
NAS搭載のHDDの稼働音の方がよっぽどうるさい。

一つだけ注意喚起だが、DisplayPortは特に接続口が太いケーブルが多いが、この商品はそこまで端子幅が広くないため、接続できない場合がある。
具体的にはUGREENのDisplayPort(https://www.amazon.co.jp/gp/product/B07QR1QGD6/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1)を三連で接続ができない(ケーブル自体はとても良いものだが)
私の場合は一本細いケーブルを真ん中に挟むことで対応した。

data.label: MSI GAMING GeForce GTX 980 4GB OC DirectX 12 VR READY (GTX 980 GAMING 4G)
data.description: MSI GTX 980 GAMING 4G: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980, 4GB 256-bit GDDR5, DL-DVI-I, HDMI, 3 Display Ports, PCI Express 3.0 Graphics Card.

Reviews.title: CRAZY POWERFUL BEAST!!!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2015
Reviews.text:
First some system specs so you know there are no bottlenecks:
Motherboard: MSI Z97 G-45 Gaming
Power Supply: Corsair CX750M
Operating System: Windows 10-64Bit
RAM: 4x8GB DDR3 HyperX Fury Red and Black, 32 GB total
Storage: 1 Samsung 850 EVO 500 GB SSD, 1x1TB WD Blue Hard Drve
CPU: i5-4690k Overclocked to 4.5 GHZ
GPU: MSI GTX 980 Gaming 4G Overclocked to 1500 MHz
Cooling: Corsair H110 GT AIO Cooler
2 Noctua NF-F12 iPPC 3000 RPM fans
2 Fractal 140 MM case Fans
2 Noctua NF-F12 iPPC 2000 RPM case Fans

Overclocking Review:
Now that's out of the way and you know I have no bottlenecks here's a review, this card takes overclocking with MSI Afterburner like a champ, with fans set to 100% its amazingly quiet, also each fan spins independently of each other. So in the overclock utility it is set to 100% but the second fan over the VRM won't kick on till its actually needed past a temperature of 60C even if you set fan speeds to 100% in MSI afterburner it only controls the fan over the GPU heat sink. Right now I have it overclocked @ 1500 MHz and the memory overclocked to an effective speed of 8000 MHZ although this is not necessary for other users its nice to know it can hit that reliably and stay stable in games. It's "military class" components and awesome cooling design definitely help there. This card takes voltage like no one else it is incredibly easy to overclock to 1500 MHZ(200-300 MHZ over stock boost) using simple YouTube guides and get a 1000 MHz increase memory overclock. It seriously increases the longevity of this card for future gaming, it hits well above 85 FPS in most games, that aren't capped of course, on very high and ultra settings. Also with good case ventilation I haven't seen this card go past 60 C once while overclocked! At idle depending on ambient temps its stayed between 26C-30C

Stock:
Stock this card still shines bright. I have found no AA or AAA title this card doesn't excel with, in no game I have played has it gone lower than 70-75 FPS except for where certain games are capped at 60 maximum, it is an amazing card that will last quite some time. Also important to note the card is dead silent and cool. It idles at near ambient temps at 25C and stayed between 45-55C in testing.

So in conclusion:

Pros:
Beast of a card- can easily handle all games and future games for the next 2-3 years no problem on high, very high or ultra
Stays cool regardless of overclocking or not
Takes overclocking like a champ
Hardcore components that allow overclocking longevity: HI C capacitors, solid capacitors and super ferrite chokes, mean it can take higher voltages and temps easily
Super Quiet!

Cons:
Lacks a back plate- would like to see a ventilated back plate to help with rigidity, this card is quite long and heavy and the pcb has the slightest bend to it-not detrimental but would like to see one for at least aesthetic appeal
Size-You must have a decent size case for this card, luckily the Fractal Define S handles it no problem, it's quite large due to that awesome twin frozr cooler and the lengthy thick PCB to help with overclocking and heat dissipation

Reccomendations:
MAKE SURE YOUR PSU HAS TWO 8 PIN PCI POWER CONNECTORS!!!!!-this card is factory overclocked and has some serious power requirements, I recommend at least a 80 PLUS Bronze or higher power supply with a 750 Watt rating, 500 watts as they recommend isn't enough headroom if you run a i5 like me or an i7.
Case ventilation and size- this card is almost 11 inches long and 4.5-5 inches wide so make sure your case can accommodate it Also I recommend at least one intake fan with a filter pulling fresh cool air into the case towards the front of the GPU so it doesn't have to deal with higher case temps in the future.

ALL IN ALL: This card is worth the money if you are looking for a long term gaming GPU and is worth the $500 price tag, however if you have the extra +$180 at the time of this review and want something that will last even longer a 980 Ti from MSI would be a good choice, for me when I bought this card the 980ti came out like a week after purchase but this was so worth the money

Reviews.title: Excellent video card! Some caveats to be aware of.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2014
Reviews.text:
I bought this card around a month ago as an upgrade over the EVGA GTX 670 FTW Edition that I had before. It was during the period where 980s were in very short supply and there was a lot of price gouging by 3rd-party sellers and I managed to snag one of these from Amazon at retail price. This past month, I have had literally no problems with this card and I am extremely satisfied with my purchase.

Pros:
Quiet: the fans on this card completely turn off when the temperature is under 50 C (see note at the bottom). This results in silent normal operation but when the card gets hot, the fans turn on quickly and stabilize the temperature. But they are still no louder than my case fans and I can barely hear the GPU fans while gaming. Additionally, I have not noticed any coil whine that has troubled numerous other 980 and 970 models.

Cool: I have not seen the GPU temp exceed 67 C even while playing demanding games like BF4 and AC: Unity at maximum settings. The driver-operated fan manages to maintain this temperature at 50% speed, which is impressive, though the second fan is VBIOS-controlled and could be running at a different speed. Idle temp is around 32 C, which is pretty good for a card whose fans aren't even running at that temperature. The cooling solution is more effective than the blower fan on my old 670 by far.

Fast: This is one of the best-performing cards on the market at this time. Boost clocks are 1327 MHz on my card and it can handle everything I throw at it. I'm running BF4 at max graphics except for no antialiasing at 120% resolution scale and I normally get over 100 FPS. I can smoothly play AC: Unity at maximum graphics settings including TXAA without any stuttering or frame drops. Basically this thing can handle everything you can throw at it at 1080p without any problems.

Cons:
Price??? Not really a con, but $580 isn't cheap. But you get what you pay for and you're getting a lot.

MSI Live Update: it doesn't work on my system. I can't get my VBIOS version information or any useful info out of this application.

Caveats: not really cons, but things to be careful of.

VBIOS: The default video card BIOS that came with my card had a bug where it would say the fan is running at 1% of its max speed even though the fan wasn't actually spinning. A video BIOS update from MSI fixed it, but as far as I know, this BIOS update has to be found on the MSI forum, not via its update utility. The new BIOS also seemed to tweak the fan profile; the fan now starts spinning when the temp reaches 50 C. I vaguely remember that the fan would start at 55 C using the old BIOS. Neither issue is actually problematic as the fans are so effective and they start properly, but it's something to keep in mind: VBIOS update beneficial.
HOWEVER, if you plan to use the newer Nvidia drivers, you MUST update your bios as the newer drivers (after 344.16) don't work well with the old bios. This is a BIOS problem, so newer drivers require newer VBIOS.

Drivers: I have heard that there are problems with the past few NVidia graphics drivers. I'm running an old version, 344.16, which most people say is stable and has been perfectly stable in my experience. I am using an HDMI connection and those with DisplayPort and UHD screens might have issues with this driver (these appear to be fixed in the latest beta driver 344.80).

Size: Make sure you know how long this card is! I bought this card basically on a whim as it was the only one available at a reasonable price. This card is an inch longer than a standard card and might not fit into smaller cases. I was lucky and it just barely fits in my Zalman mid-tower case. Check the specs!

Trivia: You get an MSI gaming mousepad along with the video card. It's a nice, large, stable mousepad with plenty of friction for precise mouse movements, but it has a strong plastic smell that fortunately dissipates with time.

Overall I could not be happier with my purchase. This video card and the GPU within are great in every respect.

Reviews.title: 2022 Gaming PC
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2022
Reviews.text: The 4GB VRAM is this card's only real limitation. I got it here for $325. It came wrapped in an anti static bag and several layers of bubble wrap. Looks and performs like a brand new card. Out performs a more expensive 1050ti because of the 256-bit memory bus and it overclocks easily with afterburner because of it's excellent cooling (with good case airflow.) I can play most modern titles at 1080p on medium or high settings and get decent frame rates. Textures and draw distance are limited by the 4 GB VRAM but in the current shortage it is just the ticket for a mid range gaming build. Paired with an i7 4790k, 16GB DDR 3, it's a great PC that will easily last to the end of the Win10 life cycle. Seller came through as promised.

Reviews.title: Sexy.Sturdy.Silent
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2015
Reviews.text:
Ok this is amazing. PURELY AMAZING! So I myself haven't been able to use it in a computer I built yet, but My friend recently built a computer and I asked whether I could use his PC to test this card out and he agreed. He had a Z97-A and 4690K. Now on with the review:

Build Quality:
There was no sag, and the card felt sturdy and well built, I wish a backplate came included though. It was hard to mount in the S340 though, since the expansion slot and expansion slot holes were a bit hard to line up. It's not very long, which is good since MSI managed to fit amazing components and keep the PCB a size that would fit in most cases.

Aesthetics:
I think this card looks like a boss, and believe it or not, its a bit customizable. Now some people think that you can only use this in red and black builds, but you can dismantle the fan shroud super easily by getting the screws out, and painting them whatever you want. I painted mine black and white, and it looked sexy. The LED is white, and its not too bright either. There's even a small engraving on the side of the card saying dragon army.

Noise:
The MSI GTX 980 is extremely quiet. This is because during idle the fans spin off, and start to spin once the card gets to 60 degrees. I think its 60 degrees, might be a little less. However even when spinning, it's extremely quiet, no noticeable coil whine while running Folding@Home which puts both the CPU and GPU to 100 percent. While gaming and benchmarking it was also quiet.

Performance:
Obviously, it's a total beast. I was getting above 60 FPS on FurMark (Core),Unigine 4.0 (Extreme Preset), and GTA V with maxed out settings at 1080p Once I started overclocking it (on one wire delivering power so it could be more stable) i got 1520 mhz while barely raising the power target, but since there was one wire, i didn't want to risk stability. Overclocking depends on silicon lottery, and I got pretty lucky.

Conclusion: Would I buy it again? Yes. Do I think the 970 is bang for buck? No, because the price has dropped down to 500 bucks for this, and the R9 390 outperforms the 970. So I would say, this does bring more bang for buck compared to the 970. Sadly however, I do plan on selling this and getting a Zotac AMP! Extreme 980 Ti. However, I would recommend this variation of the 980 as it is a fantastic card that should last you a while.

Reviews.title: Fantastic card.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2015
Reviews.text:
This is a fantastic card. Of course to run such a powerful card, it has to be coupled with equally powerful supporting hardware like CPU, RAM etc.

The performance output of this card is 100%. At least till now, i will see when the new-gen games of 2015 come out, but till now for the games of 2014, it's output is 100%, not a single loss of frame while running in High / Ultra settings. Apply V-Sync and you get a solid 60 FPS, lift it up and you go beyond 150 FPS, apply 4X MSAA and you get a minimum of 130-140 FPS on BF4, that's with all other settings to Ultra.

Now comes the card's hardware, it is super quiet, while running the card at idle with 39-40 degrees temperature, i ducked down to look at the fans, they were at a complete stop. It's the new technology of Twin Frozr V design, the fans will only start spinning once the card heats up during load, after playing graphics intensive games like BF4 and Dragon Age Inquisition, i noticed the temperatures went upto 60-66 degrees which is totally normal.

The card is a little large, trust me if it looks like previous MSI GTX 600 or 700 series cards in videos or in pictures, it's larger in its actual self. I have a GZ-G1 Plus Gigabyte case, the case is big enough with very good ventilation, but i had to struggle installing the card, i had to tilt it to just get it into the case lol. But overall you won't be disappointed with the card.

Things to note: It comes with two 8-pin power connector sockets, so make sure your PSU is at least having 8-pin power connectors or 6+2 pin power connectors. Avoid installing this card in a thin / small casing, you need a medium to large case to accommodate this card. Other things to note, it doesn't have a DVI-D display port, only a DVI-I among other HDMI and other display ports.

If your monitor doesn't have a DVI-I slot, don't worry your DVI-D cable will work fine with this card provided the maximum refresh rate of your monitor is 60Hz, just connect your monitor to this card using a DVI-D (Single or Dual Link) cable in case you don't have a DVI-I cable.

But if your monitor's refresh rate is 120Hz, you will definitely need a DVI-I or a DVI-D (Dual Link) cable, single link DVI-D cable won't be enough since the lesser pins can't transmit the required digital signals.

Best of luck.

Reviews.title: card is great, guys
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2014
Reviews.text:
card is great, guys. I totally forgot about the 0db fan thing, so I freaked out a bit. I ran heaven benchmark, and the second fan began to spin at 65c. The card stayed between 65c-68c throughout the rest of the benchmark which is awesome. In idle, I get around 35-37c when fans are not spinning :D! The only way to control both fans with a fan speed is to DL their VGA fan control app from their site. I haven't tried it yet because I have no need to. The oc mode, and gaming mode, etc works great. Just a click here, and a click there and it's all set-up. This is my first MSI card because I normally go for EVGA, but I liked the design, color, and overall awesome temp control this card has. I do not overclock, or adjust voltages so i do not have a say on how well this card overclocks, but at stock overclock it's awesome. I'm sure it has even greater O.C potential because of the awesome temperatures. Obviously max's all games out on the market, and I will be picking up another one very soon.

Also, MSI logo lights up white, the card is a bit thick because of the pipes, and has NO backplate. The PCB is black though, so the look with no back plate is not too bad.

*Forgot to add, on the gaming app where you choose your OC mode, gaming mode, and silent mode, there is a "cool down" mode where fans spin at maximum speed to cool your GPU off even faster. It takes your high temp and brings it to idle temps within 40 seconds. You only do it every 5 minutes. I thought it was a cool feature :)

****UPDATE 1-23-15: I have had this card close to three months now it still performs beautifully. I bought another and now have SLI configured. The only GRIPE I have with these cards is that one of the damn fans spin at 800rpm, on both cards, every 15-20secs and then stops. I have read into this issue and people say it is a BIOS problem and I will have to update the cards BIOS. I am not going to do that because I may brick the card, and my cards are working fine as is. People have also said that reverting back to a specific driver will make it stop as well. Now I am not sure who the culprit is here: NVIDIA or MSI. All I know is that updating the BIOS seems to cure the issue. Just letting you guys know this ahead of time.

Reviews.title: Perfect card.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2014
Reviews.text:
Truly an amazing graphics card. Well done Nvidia, and well done MSI. If you are considering any of the GTX 980's, I think the MSI Gaming is by far the best choice even though it lacks a backplate like the ASUS and EVGA cards. This card just screams quality and when you take it out of the box, you will gasp. It is perfection. I've been building computers for almost 20 years now, and I have to say this is probably the most amazing graphics card I've ever had.

The card certainly isn't cheap and is overkill for 80-90% of users out there, but for those that need, and want (and can afford) it, it is the card to get. The MSI Gaming GTX 980 is so quiet it's unbelievable. The Twin Frozr fans stay off until the card hits mid 60s(C), but MSI has a cool app called Independent Fan Control, on its website which lets you set the fan speed however you want. I personally prefer fans on at all times on a high end graphics card, so I keep mine running at 30% and they make NO noise at all. During gaming I set them to 50% (and you can set each fan to different speeds if you want), and they are still silent. Completely. Temps hover around 60-63C under full load.

There doesn't seem to be any coil whine or fans issues like early 970-980s had either. They seem to have worked out all those probs now, and this card runs perfectly.

I'm using the card on a ASUS PB278Q 1440p monitor and games look absolutely stunning in 1440p.

There are absolutely no cons for this card other than the price. If you can afford it and have a solid CPU, get one now. If you only game or use 1080p though, it's prob more than you need. I'm planning on getting a second ASUS 1440p monitor here shortly so we'll see how it does then, and I may even add a second one if needed.

Highest marks MSI. Outstanding card!

Reviews.title: MSI delivering the goods.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2015
Reviews.text:
Fantastic card. If you are running at 1080p resolution then you will be able to run everything at Ultra while this baby isn't even making a squeak of noise. The Twin Frozr V technology let's only one fan go to work under light load(lower temperatures) but the other fan will kick in once the temperatures start going up. I'm currently running a triple monitor setup(5760x1080p) and while I can't get 60FPS on most games on Ultra, I can still get a stable 30FPS. And to be quite honest, that is amazing considering I haven't even overclocked this baby yet. I do plan on purchasing another 980 in the future once the price starts to lower but if you are going for multi-monitor gameplay I would recommend getting two 970s instead of one 980. The performance will be better for 15% more cost. If you are running one monitor at up to 2k resolution then one of these should be no problem.

Pros:
Runs extremely quiet when not gaming thanks to Twin Frozr V technology

MSI Gaming app allows you to fine tune as well as use multiple presets for your graphics cards to customize performance over noise

Great design with LED MSI Logo(Yes this is a pro, it will look good with window cases

DSR capability will allow you to render at higher resolutions thanks to downsampling. You will be able to play at high resolutions on a 1080p monitor if you choose.

Cons

Slower clock speeds out of the box compared to it's competitors

More expensive than the 970, but better performance as a single GPU. However, you can purchase to 970s for significantly better performance with only a 10-15% cost increase.

I recommend this card 100% for people playing on single monitors. It's a fantastic card.

Reviews.title: Recommended Upgrade for 600 Series and Lower Cards.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2014
Reviews.text:
This card fits into a CM Storm Scout 1 enclosure, which was suited for 270mm cards. This card is 9mm longer.

I upgraded my power supply from OCZ 600W to a Corsair 750W. There was only one 6 pin plus 2 pins on my old power supply and the new card required two. I don't know if corsair makes trustworthy power units, but it is what I could get a hold of. Even though the card comes with a 6 pin to 8 pin adapter, I felt the insurance provided by a larger PSU was worth the extra cost. I still don't understand what a 6 pin versus 6 plus 2 pin cord means. There was diagrams showing three 12V cords and the remaining three or five as grounding cords in a diagram. If you do upgrade PSU for your rig use all the new cords and don't try and use older power cords. They may not work properly.

I would not get this card if you have a 700 series. I upgraded from a HD 5700 series after saving. I have yet to enable the DSR feature and see how it plays with older games like WoW, batman arkham and TF2. I am eager to see how the benchmark improvements translate to gameplay improvements in more demanding games like LOTR: SoM and DA: I.

Reviews.title: Excellent video card for anyone looking to play games at 1080p and beyond.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2015
Reviews.text:
This card is a monster or should I say a dragon? In Skyrim with over 10 graphical overhaul mods installed at 4K the FPS never drops below 40. In non-modded Skyrim on max settings the frame rate typically stays over 100. This is with the card on default speeds, no overclocking. The most demanding game I've thrown at it so far is Metro: Last Light Redux at 1080p on ultra settings the card gets anywhere from 40 to 90 FPS.

The new Metal Gear Solid: Ground Zeroes running at 4K resolution with everything maxed out gets a minimum FPS of 21 and an average of 45. 4K is the only area where I've ever really seen the card struggle. But at 1080 to 1440p this card will crush any game you give it.

In terms of how cool (literally) this card is, my old XFX Radeon 7750 usually ran at around 47 Celsius while idle. This card in the same case runs at only 38 degrees! And the fans don't even spin til it hits 50c or more. Under hours of gaming stress I haven't seen the card ever get over 76c.

For overclockers the cards default core clock is 1190 MHz. Without changing the core voltage or power limit in Afterburner I've managed to get the core clock to 1455 MHz.

In terms of power consumption is where the new Maxwell architecture really shows, the card runs fine on my EVGA 600 watt bronze rated power supply.

Overall I'd gladly recommend this card to anyone looking to boost their PC's gaming performance.

Reviews.title: HD5770s and 6770s never came with 4GB of VRAM! AVOID!!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
Reviews.text:
The vast majority of HD6770s did not come with a VGA port. The real ones also require a 6-pin power connector. Most cards that have an output layout like this are fake and, seeing reviews from people saying it won't run DX11, I'm inclined to believe this isn't even a 6770 as those did run DX11. The listed clock speed is about 200mhz lower than the original cards which, at best, points to these being faulty cards flashed with a different BIOS to operate at a lower clock speed. HD 5770s and 6770s (same card with 2 names) also NEVER came with 4GB of VRAM.

Again, this points to this being a card with a fake BIOS. I've tested another faked GPU claiming to be a GTX 960 4GB and the card even reported itself as such to the computer. In actuality it was a GT640 with 1GB of VRAM. When a game would try to utilize the reported 4GB of VRAM that didn't exist, it would cause the computer to crash.

Best case scenario here, you get a GPU that was originally released in 2009 (as the 5770, again, identical to the 6770...AMD just renamed the same card 2 years later) which has not received driver support since 2015, running at 76% of it's original speed (which may be how it gets away without a 6 pin power connector...but I doubt it) and have to spend some time dialing in settings to avoid games using more than 1GB of VRAM so the computer won't crash. In other words KEEP SHOPPING!

Reviews.title: I NEEDED A CARD TO CRUISE AROUND THE INTERNET WITHOUT ISSUE AND THIS IS IT!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
Reviews.text:
I just needed a basic video card to cruise around the internet without being stifled by lame performance of a cheap video card. While this card is a tad expensive it is not priced at the ridiculously insane prices of the middle to high end gaming video cards in 2022. This GPU has done the job of letting me go anywhere on the internet without video lag.

I had a more expensive NVIDIA GPU in my system with otherwise state of the art hardware. The newest most power Ryzen 9 \ 5900 CPU, fast memory and a 750 watt power supply. The NVIDIA GPU ran like hot garbage on my Ubuntu system. Ubuntu has a nasty sepia color scheme that saturates the entire OS and everything in it. It is not only ugly but painful to look at due to my vision issues.

I did not know for sure at the time but, I hoped a new video card from someone other than NVIDIA might perform better. Turns out this AMD designed GPU got rid of the nasty sepia tint. This video card creates a simple un-tinted OS that is a pleasure to use. The card is not BIG and uses only the power supplied by the GPU slot.

The card has some energy saver garbage installed that turns the card off if you power down your monitor. I took a star off for the energy saver mess. There really are no other issues. This is a great card to use on a Linux\Ubuntu system that is not used for hard core gaming.

Reviews.title: It does what I needed it to do
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
Reviews.text:
At my workplace I needed this half-height graphics card for a PC running a graphics intensive application that was practically unusable using the on-board graphics on the PC. Installing this card resolved the performance issues. I was pleased enough with that purchase that I bought one for my home computer to resolve some lag issues when playing 4K video on my old PC. This card resolved that issue, too. I don't know how this product benchmarks against the completion. I didn't do any testing like that. I simply had performance issues with applications that needed a graphics card performance boost. The price was right on this graphics card and I found that it worked fine to resolve those issues.

The only issue that I had was that the package came with no English instructions, no drivers and no software. I am an IT technician by trade, so I had little trouble finding the right drivers and software online. On one PC, Windows Update found the drivers, but I still had to download and install the correct version of the Radeon software. On the other PC I had to download both the drivers and software. So, this wasn't much of a problem for me, but it may be more than a novice PC users can deal with.

This product did what I needed and I've had no problems with it either at home or at work. It gets a 5 star rating from me even though I would have expected better instructions for installing the product and obtaining the correct drivers & software.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on August 29, 2022
Reviews.text:
Diese Grafikkarte ist absolout NICHT VR fähig ! Wer VR möchte MUSS mehr investieren !

Dennoch möchte ich diese Grafikkarte einmal für ihre erstaunliche und herausragende Leistung loben.
Hier hat MAXSUN alles richtig gemacht!

Ich habe einen Rechner mit ordentlich Leistung und natürlich auch mit einer entsprechenden Grafikkarte um damit die Valve Index VR-Brille zu betreiben. Ich bekam ein ausrangiertes Fujitsu Esprimo C710 mit USB3.0 und einem betagten aber ausreichenden Prozessor und suchte nun nach einer Low Profile Grafikkarte, die dabei auch noch schlank und bestmögliche Leistung bringen sollte.

Mein verrückter Plan:
Wenn an meinem Rechner was abraucht, sollte der kleine Esprimo das Ganze überbrücken.
Mit 32GB RAM und der MAXSUN Radeon RX 550 ist mir das sehr gut gelungen.
Wir reden hier natürlich von minimalistischen Grafikeinstellungen ABER BeatSaber, Phasmophobia (SinglePlayer), Pistol Whip und Blade & Sorcery sind durchaus spielbar und die Karte wird dabei nicht übermäßig heiß. Half Life - Alyx hingegen lagt sehr deutlich (wie es auch zu erwarten ist)

Dies ist keine Kaufempfehlung für VR, es soll aber verdeutlichen, was die kleine Karte auf dem Kasten hat.
Denn hier schlägt sie die vergleichbare GT 1030 um längen. Für Titel wie Diablo III und Co ifinde ich die RX 550 völlig in Ordnung und sie macht dort auch eine echt gute Figur.

Fazit: Es gibt natürlich deutlich stärkere Grafikkarten, egal ob AMD oder NVIDIA aber wer bei dem aktuellen Auf und Ab der Grafikkartenpreise eine günstige und verhältnismäßig starke Grafikkarte sucht, weil er sich gerade keine große leisten kann oder wie bei mir für einen kleineren Zweitrechner, sollte hier gut bedient sein.

Hab wirklich lange und intensiv nach einer neuen, bezahlbaren und vom Preis nicht so abgehobenen Grafikkarte gesucht. Hier passt das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis für mich gerade noch so. Wir zocken wenig wenn dann Strategiespiele, Autorennen usw eine unserer Anforderungen war die Grafik entscheidend zu verbessern ohne Unmengen Geld zu investieren. Also neuer Monitor, Grafikkarte und ein zusätzlicher Speicherblock. Das Ergebnis kann sich mehr als sehen lassen!!!
Kein geruckel mehr und eine schön saubere Grafik, das beste die Grafikkarte wird bei uns nicht mal warm, läuft also alles sauber. Für 160€ kann man bei der Karte nichts verkehrt machen!

A family member had their monitor burn out and a 4K monitor was bought. Sadly, the built-in video card in the older computer was not strong enough to support the max resolution.

This video card did exactly that. And it is fine for a computer that is used for surfing, basic desktop work, etc. But once you want to watch a full-screen 4K video it struggles. Badly.
To be fair here, the 10-series were not built for 4K. But it needs to be said: it is one thing to do static work on 4K resolutions; once you go to a high-quality media display this is not the card you are looking for.

So this card does what it needs to do - and it will perform fine for most things in resolutions under 4k. It is affordable and available. But don't buy this one for high-quality gaming or intensive video or animation work.

Though in Beam.NG, visual settings have to be set to Low for decent-good FPS. It keeps at a decent temperature (35-45°C) while being run at 100% consistently. If you're looking for a good GPU for 3D dense programs such as Second Life, this one is more then capable with the sacrifice of FPS (25-30 at High, 10-15 at Ultra graphics settings).

Reviews.title: Good but...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
Reviews.text:
Used on a new build and it was perfect for 1080p, meh for 1440 and if everything was on ultra low you could get through 4k resolutions. I play mostly Apex.
I did not buy this for 4k gaming, it wasnt built for that, built on kind of a budget.
Using the alt+tab the screen would go blank or the pc would freeze requiring reboot. Watching movies from my Hard Drive it would freeze and never a reboot. These are known driver issues so I didnt knock any stars off.
The fan was really quiet even when stressing the card.l for lengths of time. My Xbox One X fan is louder than this one.
After a week of just wanting more, I returned and bought Sapphire Nitro+ 5700 xt. That card is a head Turner, Apex 4k max setting all day.
The AMD Adrenaline had me pushing 90fps at 1080p on Apex on Ultra and 50ish at 1440p.
This card is a great 1080p card but dont expect much more from it.
Gigabyte Aorus x570 Elite
16gb DDR4 3600
Ryzen 2600
Was the 5500xt, now is 5700xt.

**Last Christmas I built my son a PC and after I did all the updates from AMD Radeon it has not crashed or black-screen'd once on him once this entire year** I just happened to check the most recent reviews, they must not be updating the Radeon Drivers from AMD after initial installation.

Reviews.title: Don't install on older mother board with legacy bios
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020

Spent 3 hours along with my younger brother trying to find out why it would only boot to bios and black screen after rechecking and reconnecting everything each time. First I though it may be a defected new power supply unit or defected new graphic card, but we test on a PC built around 2018 and it works fine. I now in the process of building a new PC. The requirement doesn't say it won't work on legacy bios even if all the hard ware requirement is meet.

Reviews.title: Great card. Relatively quiet stock
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2016
Reviews.text:
Great card. Relatively quiet stock. You can leave default settings and just enjoy it. Unigene heaven score stock was 2745, with a min of 30, avg of 109, and a max of 225 fps at 1080p, everything completely maxed out.

If you want to play around with overclocking it, grab the free MSI Afterburner 4.3 software (currently in beta at the time of this writing) and you can go in and set custom fan curve profiles based on the card temp, it's really nice. I set mine between 80-100% fan speed from 70 degrees and up to keep it under 83 and just see what it could do. Haven't touched voltages, power, or memory settings at all. Was able to get +235Mhz on the core with the increased fan speed and Heaven 4.0 scores went up to: 30.3 min, 116 avg, 242.3 max. This was just for fun, you really don't need to OC and I really like the quite operation at stock so I put it back for now. But it's good to know you can squeeze some more performance out of it if you need to.

I was able to get this card for just over MSRP, which is crazy right now because they're so overpriced. I was on the fence between the 1070 and the 1080. Wasn't sure if it was worth the extra money for the 1080. Now I'm glad I pulled the trigger. No regrets. Get this card!!

Reviews.title: Great GPU, no problems, stays cool, does it's job.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2018
Reviews.text: its a 1080, what more need I say? If your buying a 1080 you know why. BTW for more detail I put this in a smallish case pc, not small-form pc but a smaller PC from like 7 years ago, it BARELY fits in the case but still has no overheating issues. I know alot of people like to get those big fat dual fans that other sellers add on, but this fan blows OUTWARD rather than blowing air onto the thing, it works just as well if not a little better than blowing air onto it. I always buy GPUs with outward blowing fans. Just keep in mind this card is MASSIVE, highly recommend you have your screws to secure it already, it doesn't come with any and setting it in without any may be fine, but I don't recommend it.

Reviews.title: Great card to play at 2560x1440p
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2018
Reviews.text: Great graphics card. I opted for a blower style card to keep temps down in my Silverstone RVZ03 so it does get hot and won't turbo as hard as opposed to a card with an open style cooler, but usually see it hitting anywhere from 1797-1898 mhz on the core via gpu boost. Never see the core go higher than 82c. I do have a custom fan curve so it can turbo higher at the expense of volume but I have some monitors to drown out any sound emmited from the card. I use this card to drive a 1440p monitor @ 75 hz and can usually max out most games at this framerate but usually see it dish out 60 fps more often than not at max settings for AAA titles. Great card and I do recommend.

Reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS DECADE OLD GPU (unless that's what you actually want)
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2022
Reviews.text:
This GPU is from 2011. Not 2021, 2011. You might have been running Windows XP when this thing came out, maybe Windows 7, but it predates Windows 10. Let me say that again: WINDOWS 10 DID NOT EXIST when this GPU was made. This is absolutely not a Radeon RX 6700 nor even on the same planet as one. You'd be pairing this CPU with a nice new Sandy Bridge 2nd gen Core i5 CPU at the time. (We're on 12th gen now.)

I'm not saying don't buy one of these cards—I bought one last year (mid 2021) at the height of GPU price insanity. Granted, I bought it for a retrogaming PC that runs games from 2007 under Windows XP. It runs those DX9 titles pretty fast, I'll tell ya! It's all right under DirectX 10 too. It's overpowered for my purpose and would be much more at home on a Windows 7 machine. Y'know, Windows 7, before 8, 8.1, 10, and now Windows 11.

If you know that, and if you know that the price the seller is asking is fair for what you're getting (which can be literally any card in the line—it won't be a high-end model), okay. Do your research first though, because this kinda looks like the seller is hoping you'll think you're buying an RX 6700 for a good deal. You're not. You're buying a card three generations older than the RX 270.

As of the time of writing this, it's possible to find brand new RX 6500 cards in stock for MSRP without looking too hard. Yes, it's a low-end card. Yes, only four PCIe lanes at PCIe gen 4 speeds.

data.label: ASUS GeForce GTX 1060 6GB ROG Strix OC Edition VR Ready HDMI 2.0 DP 1.4 Graphic Card (STRIX-GTX1060-O6G-GAMING)
data.description: Powered by NVIDIA Pascal, ROG Strix GTX 1060 is the perfect blend of price, performance and style. Its 1873 MHz Boost Clock (OC Mode) with SAP II are cooled by DirectCU III and new ASUS FanConnect, while Aura RGB lighting on the shroud delivers a distinctive, customized look.

Reviews.title: This card looks great and performs like a champ
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2016
Reviews.text:
I do mostly video editing and a little gaming on my home computer. When I put my computer together, almost two years ago, I wasn't able to purchase an updated card. When I saw the release of the new 10 series Nvidia line come out, I new the wait was in my favor. Not being a hard core gamer, I wasn't willing to spend $400+ on a GTX 1070 or 1080. I was confident a 1060 would suit my needs, the question was "which one"? I almost bought one of the OC versions of the EVGA line, but they just lacked the WOW factor for me. When I made my decision, I chose this card. Some people have complained about the price, but matching up ROG components (I have a Asus ROG Crosshair V Formula Z motherboard) and the added Aura lighting feature made the extra money worth it for me. This card is BIG, almost 12" long and takes up two slots, measure your case before buying.

This card looks great and performs like a champ. I run an older RC flight sim called Real Flight. In the past, I was able to squeeze 40-50 FPS in the more graphic intense areas. I am now seeing 300-350 FPS, silky smooth and all settings at max. Portal 2 is running at 60 FPS at max settings. That doesn't sound that impresive, but many people have complained about low frame rates with this particular game. At 60 FPS, the visual experience and responsivness of the controls are amazing. If you're looking for a good mid-ranged card and don't want to spend $400-$600 to get a 1070 or 1080, this card is a winner. It looks great in my case too. Good Luck! Hope this review helps make your decision easier. /Jeff

Reviews.title: This card is absolutely amazing! I will actually write a lot more and ...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
Reviews.text:
I have had this card now for a couple of weeks. I don't even know where to begin. This card is absolutely amazing!

I will actually write a lot more and post more information about this card with more reviews in the future. So bear with me as I won't make this terribly long.

If you are like myself and game @1080 then this is the best no holds barred card for that I have seen. Yes there are other 1060's that are cheaper. But believe me that this is the cream of the crop. It crushes all games at 1080. I have everything at Ultra or very near Ultra and I have amazing frame rates and consistency. The dips in FPS are few and most amazingly it sips power.

One thing though. The moment I installed the card; I started to play and the temp of the GPU shot up as high as 90 degrees C. That was not acceptable. On average playing CS:GO I was getting up to 80~ degrees C. I had the settings at max, but this cooler is meant to cool even the mighty GTX 1080. SO something was not right.

I So I removed the heatsink, cleaned off the paste and used new thermal paste. I put it back together, and INSTANTLY the temperatures dropped!!!

When running the benchmarks I was hitting 82-88 degrees C with the fans spinning up to 85-100%. Now It is pushing 62-64 degrees C after running it for 30 min!

So if you buy this card, do yourself the favor and get new thermal paste and change the GPU's thermal paste.

Reviews.title: Great for VR, not the best option but pretty awesome, here's why...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2016
Reviews.text:
Great for VR based on both the power of the card and the output options. Supports recording via OBS. Supports DirectX 12. Provides 2 HDMI ports, which is great because one will be required for the VR headset, and it's nice to use the second one for TV output. Anyway, it also has DVI for your monitor (assuming you use DVI, otherwise, you use the HDMI?) and two other display ports I never use (lol). In any case, you should be able to get adapters if you need to convert more ports to HDMI, and it provides 2 already, so you're golden.

At its base clock speed, this card is fairly quiet and fairly powerful. It runs most VR games at a smooth 90fps with no problems, and it even holds up while recording video of the experience. I even have a bottleneck of a weak processor and this card makes my experience mostly pleasant. It can be boosted or overclocked if necessary to get a little extra power, but I have not tested how that runs, because honestly, I don't need to at this time. If you are in the market for an upgrade from a more budget-worthy card, like the 750 Ti (what I had) as a way of making your fairly old rig VR ready, this should do the job nicely.

Oh, and the lights look cool if that matters to you.

Reviews.title: A fantastically quick, and colorful graphics card for 19 to 24 inch Monitors that runs modern games without a hiccup.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2016
Reviews.text: Purchased this as a second graphics card for my second and third monitors in order to free up all the resources of my 1080 for my gaming monitor. Both cards are ROG STRIX Editions. The lights are really cool and add to the aesthetics of your case. More than that, the card is very powerful, which performs slightly better than 780Ti OC edition that cost me $800 three years ago. As a single card it will still run most games very smoothly at high resolution on 19-24 inch monitors. The price is a bargain. With three fans it runs very cool. It's large heat sync performs so well that under normal computer workloads, it never exceeds 38 degrees C, a range where the fans don't even need to run. It makes this card very quiet. It's only a few dollars more than Asus's two fan version of the same card. The extra dollars are worth it for more efficient cooling and lighting. The card is large and long so pay attention to the dimensions and make sure it will fit in your case before you purchase it. On the outside, it looks identical to the 1080.

Reviews.title: very pleased with this product so far
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2016
Reviews.text:
Very, very pleased with this product so far. I upgraded from a GTX 650 Ti Boost after having that for about three years. So far, I've been able to run The Witcher 3 on Ultra with no issues and Arkham Knight ran incredibly well on high settings. I'm excited to try it out on a newer release like BF1.

As a warning to people, though, make sure your tower can fit this thing. It's a beast. It completely dwarfs my old video card, not only in power, but in size. You'll really want to check the size specs and then measure your tower. I know it's a huge pain but I'm glad I did it. My tower is pretty large and this thing still fits snug.

The installation was also very simple for me - had no issues taking out the old card, slapping this one in and booting the system. Just... uh... make sure you remove the plastic covers before you try and fit it into the motherboard... Not that I'm speaking from experience or anything...

Reviews.title: Sometimes Makes Loud Fan Noise. Trickey to Install, Watch Youtube Help Video and See my Notes.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
Reviews.text: I bought this product for video processing of insta360 360 and 3D videos from my camera. It replaced an older graphics card that could no longer do video processing. I'm not a PC gamer, but have experimented with Unity development of experiences and needed this GPU for that. When running high intensity activity like the video processing and my Unity experience/game, the fan/noise is on and loud. Noise cycles on/off depending on the GPU requirement of my programs running. I watched YouTube videos to learn how to install this, and let me say it was a very TIGHT fit and fingers got jammed a little making this fit in the standard PC. VERY IMPORTANT: You will need to power this card with a connector, which you should have tied up somewhere to your board, but most out of the box graphic cards in PC do not have the extra power requirement and just plug right in. So after you plug the card in to replace an existing graphic card, you must also connect the extra power cable from the board to the card for it to work.

Reviews.title: Great card, garbage software
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2017
Reviews.text: Update review: Excellent card for the money. It handles everything I throw at it, including a poorly optimized buggy mess like PUBG. Never any issues with the card at all. Runs great, never any heat issues, beautiful lighting. The one downside: ASUS software is a mess. Getting the lights to actually do what you want and not revert back to defaults is a pain. eg: Let the computer go to sleep and when you come back your lights will be blinking instead of static, etc. If you have the software set to load with boot it WILL put a big load on your system and slow down your boot up times. I haven't even bothered with overclocking because I'm so worried the ASUS software will screw something up. If you're one of those people who is going to delve into your GPU's settings and software and fiddle with things, maybe find a different brand.

Reviews.title: Excellent Replacement!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
Reviews.text: Already has the one old one in SLI setup but works as individual VGA card, even the card itself is not SLI camptible, still used as a spare VGA if need 2 cards, Great quality from ASUS, customer will always standby, better than EVGA which implied life time warranty but it never promised, use several EVGA card before on 1080 series but failed in 2 years, and customer never went through by that 1-800 customer service. Dealt with ASUS before, that's why stay with ASUS, it will solve the issue no matter what!

Reviews.title: Only reason it died is cpu cooler failure.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
Reviews.text: My liquid cooler leaked, and it killed this poor baby. Not the gpu's fault at all. This is a solid gpu. I ran this thing for 4 years under full overclock in a eatx case and it never throttled or died on me once. It's been through 3 computers, and server all of them well. Even if a 1060 is old, I can say this at least for Asus's, this is a reliable AF card that was built extremely well. Rest in peace 1060, you did well...

data.label: Wendry Graphics Card GPU Brace Support, Computer Independent Graphics Aluminum Alloy Bracket, Independent Load-Bearing Bracket Can Safely Support PCB (red)
data.description:
