Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Australia on December 27, 2019
Reviews.text: Do you like cables? What about risers? If you answered yes to one or both of those questions then this riser cable will tickle your fancy. What can I say about this riser cable that hasn't already been said about it in the description on the webstore page? It's as described I guess. It does what it's supposed to do. Oh. Oh! Yes. Don't fold it unless you're 100 % sure that's where you want it folded forever. It's a bit more expensive than I would have personally liked but what else is new?

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on July 20, 2022
Reviews.text: Das Kabel ist gut verpackt und die Kontakte sind durch Abdeckungen geschützt. Einbau ging einfach und die Kabellänge (ca. 30 cm) ist völlig ausreichend bei mir (USB Zusatzkarte im Steckplatz auf dem Mainboard). Ein Punkt Abzug wegen des hohen Preises.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on August 11, 2021
Reviews.text:
Selbst wenn man kein Thermaltake Gehäuse hat ist dieses Riser Kabel unbedingt zu empfehlen und kaufenswert!

+ Sehr hochwertige Verarbeitung
+ Sitzt sicher im Mainboard Slot
+ Grafikkarte sitzt sicher im Kabelslot
+ Sehr biegsam und flexibel weil es nicht ein Kabelstrang, sondern mehrere einzelne Flachkabel sind.
+ Ist mir beim Wasserkühlung bauen nass geworden, funktioniert immer noch tadellos.

Und das Beste: Laut meinen Testergebnissen unterstützt es auch PCI Express 4.0! (siehe Bilder) Macht zwar nur maximal 1% Leistung zu PCIE 3.0 in Games aus aber umso besser!

Na toll, habe ein neues 4.0 Kabel bestellt, welches ich nun erfreulicherweise umtauschen werde und somit 60 Euro spare. Mein Tipp: Wenn ihr unter dem PCI slot noch was stecken habt z.B. eine Soundkarte dann kauft euch das 30 cm Kabel, das hat die ideale Länge!

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Italy on January 20, 2020
Reviews.text:
Dopo moltissimo tempo finalmente un prodotto di livello professionale ad un costo "accessibile". Siamo un ufficio "render farm" e quindi di GPU ne abbiamo bisogno. Finora abbiamo trovato validi cavi soltanto su cifre oltre i 150 euro (a cavo), abbiamo provato svariati cavi "cinesi" da 20-25 euro, tuttavia l'utilizzo intensivo porta a crash e bluescreen già dopo pochi minuti di stress test.
Per uno dei nostri pc, appena aggiornato con 2 RTX2070 super (+ una 960 4gb sulla piastra madre), abbiamo provato invogliati dalle recensioni positive questi cavi, collegando le schede con 2 di questi cavi.
Spettacolari. tutto operativo al primo collegamento, nessun intoppo e dopo 1 settimana di lavoro nessun problema. Lasciati in stress test con rendering impegnativi anche da una nottata intera, nessun lag o bluescreen (cosa frequente con cavi di scarsa qualità). Speriamo continui così ma per il momento siamo estremamente soddisfatti.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on November 30, 2020
Reviews.text:
Ich habe das Kabel bereits seid Ende 2018 in Gebrauch und kann abseits des etwas hohen Preises nichts negatives drüber berichten, es macht was es soll.
Zusätzlich funktioniert es bei mir sogar mit PCIe 4.0, zumindest wird mir dies von GPU-Z und der Systeminformation in der Nvidia Systemsteuerung so angezeigt. Abstürze oder der gleichen die dagegen sprechen hatte ich auch noch keine.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Spain on January 9, 2018
Reviews.text: Me la jugue al comprarlo porque despues de como pintan la otra version de cable thermaltake, tenia muchas dudas, pero supuestamente en este solucionaban todos los fallos del fracaso del anterior y por mi parte tengo que decir que 0 problemas, funciona perfectamente, facil de doblar, bien acabado, no he notado perdidas de fps, no me a fallado en ningun momento, la verdad que ya digo que tenia muchas dudas ya que es muy nuevo este cable y reviews las pocas que existen son en ingles o polaco, ya digo, si alguien tiene el mismo miedo que yo a comprarlo por poca informacion, en mi caso me va perfecto, si en algun momento tubiera fallos avisaria pero de momento nada, lo tengo en una thermaltake view 71 y no me a supuesto problemas para doblarlo ni nada.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Japan on May 19, 2021
Reviews.text: しっかりと動作はした

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 5, 2018
Reviews.text:
For now it is working alright (after 2 days of stress tests). However, right after installing this and benchmarking my OC'ed GPU my system hanged and then wouldn't boot. I was forced to clear CMOS, remove the power cable for 5 minutes, remove the riser from the motherboard and put it again. Then my system followed the normal boot and was able to use it as normal.

It is a shame that you have to pay +70€ for a cable in addition to their already overpriced case.

My 3 star review is mainly for the strategy that TT decided to follow regarding their pricing methods.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Japan on February 25, 2021
Reviews.text:
PCケースをThermaltake VIEW 51 TG ARGBに新調した際に、「RTX3080を縦置きにしよう！」と当商品を購入。
ケーブルの長さもピッタリだし、シッカリとした作り。さり気ないTTのロゴもカッコイイ！。
あと、、、私が気にしていた大型グラボが邪魔でマザーボード上のM.2 SSDとサウスブリッジの冷却不足の問題も、マザーボードとグラボの間隔を開けて設置することでマザーボードにシッカリ風が当たるようになったのが良い。
（高負荷時のサウスブリッジの温度、旧構成でMAX約75℃台がグラボ縦置き構成で55～65℃台までダウンした）
グラボの縦置きは見た目の演出だけでなく、エアフロー改善にも効果はあるようです。

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on April 22, 2018
Reviews.text: Ich hatte mir ein Gehäuse eines namenhaften Herstellers für 120,-€ gekauft, diesem Gehäuse lag ein Riser bei. Nach dem Zusammenbau des Rechners war der PC instabil, 3D-Mark oder spielen waren selten möglich, selbst Youtube ruckelte... ich dachte erst an eine zu heiße CPU und an den RAM, aber nach einer echten Analyse erkannte ich, dass es am originalen Riser-Kabel lag. Nach langen hin und her hab ich mich dazu überwunden und das in meinen Augen sehr teure Thermaltake Kabel gekauft. Es ist sehr gut verarbeitet. Nach dem Einbau lief nun das ganze System wie es sollte - perfekt! Für mich eine klare Empfehlung. Das Kabel ist relativ Steif und harte Knicke sollten vermieden werden, sonst könnte die Schirmung kaputt gehen.

Reviews.title: Finally bought a Asus RX-570 with 8 gig at a price point I could tolerate and it's been great...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2019
Reviews.text:
This card seemed to have some bad reviews both on amazon and newegg but most are on complaints of DOA cards (that once again is not a review!) This is a huge pet peeve of mine and it falsely lowers the overall ratings which forces everyone to read between the lines when reading amazon reviews! Reviewers you need a working card to do a proper review and although D.O.A. cards still occur it's part of technology so just accept it and send it back for a new card under the 3 year Asus warranty or Amazons 30 day return/replace policy.
I only buy AMD Radeon video cards because Nvidia really over prices their GPU's, chipsets, and power supplies by at least 30 % and I'm not over paying for video cards no matter who produces them.
I wanted to get a good card that plays well at 1920x1080p and will still play my Military Flight Simulators and F.P.S. games without any issues. The Asus RX 570 was plenty fast enough for gaming and even scored a 71% in 3DMark which is great for a 7 year old system still running a i5 2500k CPU.

I do not over- clock my CPU (But it will run at almost 5 GHZ if I chose to do so since I have a nice closed loop water cooler) I also will never over-clock my GPU because I want stability over speed. Over-clocking really helped out back in the past with the 66 MHZ bus on the intel PII's that ran at 333 MHZ. These hit perfectly on a 100 MHZ bus giving me a rock stable CPU running at 500 MHZ back when intel didn't even have a 400 MHZ CPU on the market!
But that was then and now a days the intel CPU's are being milked for all intel can get while they change their socket sizes so your forced to buy a new board as well.
This Asus RX-570 is well built even though it's fan cover is plastic it's rather light which eliminates sag issues so it's a plus not a negative. I bought it for the double ball bearing fans and 8 gig of DDR5! I waited a year for the prices to get back to normal from all the bitcoin miners and this card is well worth the money and then some. For only $162 this 570 with 8 gig of onboard ram is great value!
I don't recommend using the Asus software that comes with the card since it's very buggy and the Radeon settings can be set just fine without any additional software.

Asus Expedition RX-570_8 GIG video card Update:
I have been using the new card for almost 4 months and it runs great with both Windows 7 Pro and Windows 10 Pro 64 bit O/S's
I recently went back to Win 7 Pro over Win 10 Pro because Win 10 Pro would not run 2 of my favorite Military Sims. Well they would load and I could finish a mission but then the game would crash my system and force me to lose any pilot stats, which ruins the fun of playing realistic flight sims and could have led to some hard restarts that can damage the O/S. I know from personal use that Win 7 Pro 64 bit just runs games better than Windows 10, when it comes to compatibility, and is still a solid Operating System that most gamers still use.
Windows 10 Pro gets bad reviews across the board but I found it to be an excellent O/S with only Linux's latest being more stable and of course free.
O.K. back to the new video card. I can't find any flaws with this card at all. It lacks a black-plate but is really light weight and has a great closed loop heat pipe system, along with the great, real, ball bearing fans, that are so quiet I can't even hear them while I'm gaming. There is zero whine that other cards produce under load and I love that feature.
I only needed a good video card with 4 gig of ram and was looking at a RX-560, but this Asus card and it's 8 gig of DDR5 gave my system and game performance a great boost and was well worth the year long wait not to over pay.

If you need a solid card with quiet fans and like the idea of 8 gig of DDR 5 ram look no further! I have seen a couple of Sapphire cards inthe RX-580 series in July of 2019 priced at only $180 which would have been my first choice if I was buying today. But you can drive yourself crazy if you keep looking at current GPU's prices since the new Radeons are out and getting cheaper all the time. So I always get the best single card for the money and can always buy a second if I upgrade my CPU to a AMD Ryson 1600, my motherboard with a AM4 socket and 16 gig of DDR4 memory.
I priced out this upgrade path and for $450 I can basically get a brand new computer(self built) and add a second Asus RX-570 for Cross-Fire use.
I have bought Sapphire cards in the past and have had good luck with them however, they only have a 2 year warr. and that extra year that Asus offers can be important. I did have a Asus HD 6950 years ago that failed after 2 1/2 years and would have been a paperweight if I didn't have that extra year of warranty as Asus replaced it with no questions asked. I do tend to buy Asus motherboards and video cards since they have good RMA service and a full 3 year warranty on their boards and video cards.

Reviews.title: Not bad
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2022
Reviews.text:
I thought the Adrenaline software was a problem. It would crash when using any features. So I would just do Drivers only. My monitors would have strange lines in them till they warmed up. I could only use one at 144hz and one at 60hz or those lines would get bad. I ordered a high PPI monitor because my eyes are old. Turns out the "High Speed" Displayport Cables were not "High Speed" I switched the cables that came with the New Monitor and now I have no issues. Amazing what cables will do, and how disingenuously marks "high speed" cables will drive you crazy.

This card is very good for 1080p gaming, and medium VR gaming. Just make sure you have cables.

Reviews.title: THIS CARD IS A HOT MESS! THE FANS HARDLY EVER TURN ON! THIS CARD HEATS UP YOUR CASE & YOUR ROOM!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020
Reviews.text:
I absolutely hate this card as it runs so hot it is worthless for gaming. I have a Ryzen 9 XT CPU and it is monster fast. I have a really BIG air cooling tower with two hulking big fans to keep the CPU cool. Without this card installed my CPU is a chilled 37c. to 38c at rest. I add this ASUS TUF Gaming 3 AMD Radeon RX 5600XT OC Edition Gaming Graphics Card (PCIEe 4.0, 6GB and my CPU temps shoot up to 48c to 50c. My full ATX case and motherboard are NOT cramped. I have only the one GPU not two. My cable management is good my air flow is good.

I add this hot card whose fans never turn on and suddenly my cool case becomes a CPU hot house. Funny thing is the GPU temp is 37c and barely ever cracks 41c. Junction temps equally low. This is a nice GPU but it is a hot head. Partly my motherboard layout has the GPU pressed almost directly against the CPU cooling tower which does not help. Unfortunately this big hulking GPU never turns its fans on which might help the heat dissipation situation. Whoever came up with HOT GPU's turning off their fans should be fired never to work again in IT.

I would not buy this GPU because, it saves you money on your energy bill at the expense of heating up everything else that shares its space. This garbage ASUS TUF Gaming 3 AMD Radeon RX 5600XT OC Edition Gaming Graphics Card (PCIEe 4.0, 6GB GPU is adding to the heat index of the case while not running its fans to reduce trapped heat a very selfish short sighted design burning up everything but itself.

This GPU is more of a case mounted internal radiator than a GPU which makes it a dumpster fire garbage card to me. I'm putting it in my 34 year old kids computer where it can do no harm as all he does is buy stuff on Amazon.com.

Reviews.title: For the price, this thing is a beast!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
Reviews.text: I was hesitant buying this because of the few negative reviews. But I am now two years in and not one issue. The software updates are constant and quick. I bought this when it was $200, and now it is triple. Crazy times we live in. Runs everything I throw at it extremely smooth and fast. I have to think those that have issues are doing something wrong or just running it ragged like crypto mining.

Reviews.title: Bought before COVID
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2022
Reviews.text: It is ASUS, Card is awesome at gaming, but the company is not so good at relations. I STAND WITH UKRAINE.

Reviews.title: 5500xt is better than I thought a budget gpu could be
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
Reviews.text:
Its ama'ing what you can get for $200 I have a bunch of older games that I am using this for at 1440p high detal 165hz monitor with freesync and I'm seeing fram rates at the worse in bordlands the prequal being 40fps in crowed battles and up yo 170fps in less catotic enviroments with an avrage of 80fps

Like when you see those dips I understand why people pay for $400 gpus but if you like indie titles racing games and esports titles which is mostly what I play and a bunch of older AAA Titles I couldt run before this is perfect for me yes more gpu hoprse power would be nice but this defently enough to play on

Side note a gtx 1650 ti would be a better value but this haveing 8gb of vram kinda future proofed it a bit and leaves me room to run mods on games

Reviews.title: Its not card its drivers issues...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
Reviews.text:
I'm running this card now for month. I did have some issues with temperatures and crashing when I installed it but after updating drivers ( adrenaline 20.4.1.) it runs ok. I would recommend to install clean Windows if you keep having crashing issues and install adrenaline 20.4.1. update, not latest! I will update review if something changes.
Update:
Since card is set up by default to turn fans on over 60c I would strongly recommend to instal Asus GPU tweak from Asus web page and lower it to 40c. Somehow newest driver from radeon turned my fans completely off so Ive downgraded drivers and instaled GPU tweak... now I control fans.

Reviews.title: Good video card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2019
Reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy this given the the small quantity of reviews and the negative nature of them. However, I have always been impressed by Asus products so I decided to lean on the brand reputation and make the purchase. I had no hiccups in the installation of this video card. I installed it in my computer along withthe AMD radeon drivers.(19.4.2) I also installed the Asus GPU tweaker II software. Because of the negative reviews I wanted to stress test the card right away to make sure I didn't have a dud. I ran Furmark for an hour and it had no problems. I did find that it was throttling the clock speed down to about 900mhz during the stress test. I had to turn up the power limit in GPU tweaker to get it to hold the max clock speed under load. Overall I think it is a good product, it works and performs as expected for a mid level graphics card.

Reviews.title: Stop overpaying for this crap
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2021
Reviews.text: I bought this card a year ago for 150 bucks from the same buyer, and it was worth exactly that, DO NOT BUY THIS CARD FOR 850 BUCKS, this card wont even play WoW on a graphics setting higher than 7/10 without significant lag. stop overpaying for graphics card. and stop gouging the customer.

Reviews.title: Possible defective card received, random stuttering during gameplay
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
Reviews.text:
(This review is for the TUF 3 RX 5600 XT)
This card is insanely good compared to my old GTX 1060 and can run many games on high or ultra. It is super quiet even while under heavy load and the temperatures are really good compared to Nvidia cards. The issue that I am having is random stuttering during gameplay. It was not noticeable at first but it became annoying after a couple days of gaming. The stuttering happens every time the GPU's core clocks would drop, the core clocks on my card are never stable and keeps dropping frequency at random times causing annoying stutter. The stuttering is just too annoying and noticeable during gaming and I will be planning on returning this card for another brand. Looking at the reviews I see nobody has this issue, perhaps I am just unlucky and got a defective model.

Reviews.title: Best for the money, RGB lights are not impressive.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020
Reviews.text:
Let me start with its RGB lights: they almost do not exist, that's why my rating is 4.
Gigabyte made a very impressive 2080Ti Aorus card with gorgeous lights but not on this card.
Why Gigabyte? Why am I being punished for choosing AMD's best GPU? Does it really cost you that much to put some lights on fans?? Shame on you.
As for its performance....You can always go for the most expensive GPU on the market by paying extra extra money. That's something a stupid man would do even if he's rich. Smart one would find a card which is just as good or almost as good but costs much much less. That is 5700XT compared to 2080Ti.
Furthermore, there is something about this Aorus series, they are different than regular 5700XT of Gigabyte. Far less noisy, to start with. It performs better too. GTA5: 120fps, 1440p, full details. Fifa20, 240fps, 1440p, Ultra. Resident Evil 3, 132fps, 1440p, highest details. Enough said.
One last thing, your CPU should go along with your GPU otherwise you won't get above results or better. I started with i5-9400 and I wasn't impressed. Then I switched to 3800X and finally to 3900X and the transformation was phenomenal.
Absolutely recommended.

Reviews.title: Pretty good so far
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
Reviews.text:
Purchased to replace my 1660ti. First impressions is its a beefy card. Fits in my mid tower case, only about an inch longer than my 1660ti. I did a DDU in safe mode to remove my INVIDIA drivers and everything is working well so far with driver version 19.10.2

Only complaint I have right now is by default it operates at zero rpm mode and at 100% fan speed its way louder than my 1660ti, but a custom fan curve using wattman fixes the issue. Otherwise the card gets really hot before the fans turn on and when they do it sounds like a small jet plane.

Will update with more testing

First update, If I try to use MSI Afterburner for the onscreen overlay my monitor flickers every 3 seconds or so. This happens whenever Afterburner is running, even if I minimize it. When I close Afterburner the flicker goes away. (Edit: the new drivers have fixed this issue)

Reviews.title: Solid card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020
Reviews.text: I was originally going to wait to get my hands on the 6800 xt card that’s coming out soon but I didn’t want to risk it being out of stock like the 3000 series from nvidia. This card has been really good in both FPS and in cooling I used to have a 2060 6gb and wanted something a little more powerful so I bought this card I’m playing at 1440p and my games on the highest settings have been around 80 to 120 FPS depending on the game and how well it’s optimized. I mean it’s a solid card I would recommend it to anyone who really doesn’t want to risk another bad launch of cards.

Reviews.title: Works Great
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
Reviews.text:
I'm using this on my new 2019 Mac Pro. I replaced the stock Apple Pro 580X GPU with the Aorus RX 5700 XT. I needed to buy a Belkin cable Kit from Apple to furnish power to the two 8 pin connectors on the card. I'm running this with an LG 4K monitor. I'm not a gamer. So far everything is running fast and smooth. With Apple's new UEFI scheme, I am getting the full Apple boot screen.

Reviews.title: HD5770s and 6770s never came with 4GB of VRAM! AVOID!!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
Reviews.text:
The vast majority of HD6770s did not come with a VGA port. The real ones also require a 6-pin power connector. Most cards that have an output layout like this are fake and, seeing reviews from people saying it won't run DX11, I'm inclined to believe this isn't even a 6770 as those did run DX11. The listed clock speed is about 200mhz lower than the original cards which, at best, points to these being faulty cards flashed with a different BIOS to operate at a lower clock speed. HD 5770s and 6770s (same card with 2 names) also NEVER came with 4GB of VRAM.

Again, this points to this being a card with a fake BIOS. I've tested another faked GPU claiming to be a GTX 960 4GB and the card even reported itself as such to the computer. In actuality it was a GT640 with 1GB of VRAM. When a game would try to utilize the reported 4GB of VRAM that didn't exist, it would cause the computer to crash.

Best case scenario here, you get a GPU that was originally released in 2009 (as the 5770, again, identical to the 6770...AMD just renamed the same card 2 years later) which has not received driver support since 2015, running at 76% of it's original speed (which may be how it gets away without a 6 pin power connector...but I doubt it) and have to spend some time dialing in settings to avoid games using more than 1GB of VRAM so the computer won't crash. In other words KEEP SHOPPING!

Reviews.title: I NEEDED A CARD TO CRUISE AROUND THE INTERNET WITHOUT ISSUE AND THIS IS IT!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
Reviews.text:
I just needed a basic video card to cruise around the internet without being stifled by lame performance of a cheap video card. While this card is a tad expensive it is not priced at the ridiculously insane prices of the middle to high end gaming video cards in 2022. This GPU has done the job of letting me go anywhere on the internet without video lag.

I had a more expensive NVIDIA GPU in my system with otherwise state of the art hardware. The newest most power Ryzen 9 \ 5900 CPU, fast memory and a 750 watt power supply. The NVIDIA GPU ran like hot garbage on my Ubuntu system. Ubuntu has a nasty sepia color scheme that saturates the entire OS and everything in it. It is not only ugly but painful to look at due to my vision issues.

I did not know for sure at the time but, I hoped a new video card from someone other than NVIDIA might perform better. Turns out this AMD designed GPU got rid of the nasty sepia tint. This video card creates a simple un-tinted OS that is a pleasure to use. The card is not BIG and uses only the power supplied by the GPU slot.

The card has some energy saver garbage installed that turns the card off if you power down your monitor. I took a star off for the energy saver mess. There really are no other issues. This is a great card to use on a Linux\Ubuntu system that is not used for hard core gaming.

Reviews.title: It does what I needed it to do
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
Reviews.text:
At my workplace I needed this half-height graphics card for a PC running a graphics intensive application that was practically unusable using the on-board graphics on the PC. Installing this card resolved the performance issues. I was pleased enough with that purchase that I bought one for my home computer to resolve some lag issues when playing 4K video on my old PC. This card resolved that issue, too. I don't know how this product benchmarks against the completion. I didn't do any testing like that. I simply had performance issues with applications that needed a graphics card performance boost. The price was right on this graphics card and I found that it worked fine to resolve those issues.

The only issue that I had was that the package came with no English instructions, no drivers and no software. I am an IT technician by trade, so I had little trouble finding the right drivers and software online. On one PC, Windows Update found the drivers, but I still had to download and install the correct version of the Radeon software. On the other PC I had to download both the drivers and software. So, this wasn't much of a problem for me, but it may be more than a novice PC users can deal with.

This product did what I needed and I've had no problems with it either at home or at work. It gets a 5 star rating from me even though I would have expected better instructions for installing the product and obtaining the correct drivers & software.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on August 29, 2022
Reviews.text:
Diese Grafikkarte ist absolout NICHT VR fähig ! Wer VR möchte MUSS mehr investieren !

Dennoch möchte ich diese Grafikkarte einmal für ihre erstaunliche und herausragende Leistung loben.
Hier hat MAXSUN alles richtig gemacht!

Ich habe einen Rechner mit ordentlich Leistung und natürlich auch mit einer entsprechenden Grafikkarte um damit die Valve Index VR-Brille zu betreiben. Ich bekam ein ausrangiertes Fujitsu Esprimo C710 mit USB3.0 und einem betagten aber ausreichenden Prozessor und suchte nun nach einer Low Profile Grafikkarte, die dabei auch noch schlank und bestmögliche Leistung bringen sollte.

Mein verrückter Plan:
Wenn an meinem Rechner was abraucht, sollte der kleine Esprimo das Ganze überbrücken.
Mit 32GB RAM und der MAXSUN Radeon RX 550 ist mir das sehr gut gelungen.
Wir reden hier natürlich von minimalistischen Grafikeinstellungen ABER BeatSaber, Phasmophobia (SinglePlayer), Pistol Whip und Blade & Sorcery sind durchaus spielbar und die Karte wird dabei nicht übermäßig heiß. Half Life - Alyx hingegen lagt sehr deutlich (wie es auch zu erwarten ist)

Dies ist keine Kaufempfehlung für VR, es soll aber verdeutlichen, was die kleine Karte auf dem Kasten hat.
Denn hier schlägt sie die vergleichbare GT 1030 um längen. Für Titel wie Diablo III und Co ifinde ich die RX 550 völlig in Ordnung und sie macht dort auch eine echt gute Figur.

Fazit: Es gibt natürlich deutlich stärkere Grafikkarten, egal ob AMD oder NVIDIA aber wer bei dem aktuellen Auf und Ab der Grafikkartenpreise eine günstige und verhältnismäßig starke Grafikkarte sucht, weil er sich gerade keine große leisten kann oder wie bei mir für einen kleineren Zweitrechner, sollte hier gut bedient sein.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on September 7, 2022
Reviews.text:
Hab wirklich lange und intensiv nach einer neuen, bezahlbaren und vom Preis nicht so abgehobenen Grafikkarte gesucht. Hier passt das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis für mich gerade noch so. Wir zocken wenig wenn dann Strategiespiele, Autorennen usw eine unserer Anforderungen war die Grafik entscheidend zu verbessern ohne Unmengen Geld zu investieren. Also neuer Monitor, Grafikkarte und ein zusätzlicher Speicherblock. Das Ergebnis kann sich mehr als sehen lassen!!!
Kein geruckel mehr und eine schön saubere Grafik, das beste die Grafikkarte wird bei uns nicht mal warm, läuft also alles sauber. Für 160€ kann man bei der Karte nichts verkehrt machen!

Reviews.title: A solution to a problem.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2022
Reviews.text:
A family member had their monitor burn out and a 4K monitor was bought. Sadly, the built-in video card in the older computer was not strong enough to support the max resolution.

This video card did exactly that. And it is fine for a computer that is used for surfing, basic desktop work, etc. But once you want to watch a full-screen 4K video it struggles. Badly.
To be fair here, the 10-series were not built for 4K. But it needs to be said: it is one thing to do static work on 4K resolutions; once you go to a high-quality media display this is not the card you are looking for.

So this card does what it needs to do - and it will perform fine for most things in resolutions under 4k. It is affordable and available. But don't buy this one for high-quality gaming or intensive video or animation work.

data.description: ASUS Geforce Dual-RTX2060-06G-EVO 6GB

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in France on August 29, 2022
Reviews.text:
Acheté en Prime Day en remplacement d'une vieillissante GTX 970 sur une configuration pas toute jeune, mais qui peut encore faire ses preuves en 1080p. C'était un achat que je visais car la série RTX 2000 est la dernière qui permet d'exploiter la 3D Vision, sous réserve d'installer les pilotes d'époque - Nvidia ayant arrêté tout support pour cette technologie.

Pour le reste, je n'ai aucune réserve à formuler. Ma précédente carte appartenait à la gamme Strix, mais je n'ai pas eu l'impression de baisser de "gamme". La carte est silencieuse quand elle n'est pas sollicitée et très peu bruyante en jeu.
L'emballage était soigné, la carte en elle-même ne fait pas "cheap". Bref, rien à redire sur la fabrication.

Au niveau des compatibilités qui m'intéressent : 3D Vision (comme déjà dit plus haut), G-Sync, Dolby Atmos, RTX, DLSS ....et les ports : 2 x HDMI 2.0, DP, DVI.

Il n'y a pas de port USB-C. Dommage...

Elle est également parfaitement compatible avec la VRR, sur des télés compatibles, et avec des pilotes récents. Je recommande toutefois d'en rester alors à un affichage 1080p120 Hz, en prenant un câble HDMI High Speed (et non Ultra High Speed) si la TV a un port HDMI 2.1.
Sinon Windows aura tendance à vous forcer du 4K@30 ou 60Hz, mais ne vous proposera pas du 1080p120Hz. Donc forcez matériellement le HDMI 2.0.
Personnellement je n'ai pas besoin de jouer en 4K, et si cela avait été le cas je me serais probablement tourné vers une carte plus puissante.

PS : Pour la 3D Vision, il faut mettre les mains dans le cambouis. Perso, installation réussie sur un Windows 10 (version 1809), Geforce 452.06 puis installation du logiciel tiers « 3D Fix manager » pour forcer la restauration des drivers 3D Vision. Evidemment, ce n’est pas la configuration la plus à jour qui soit, mais c’est fonctionnel pour une partition système dont l’accès internet est limité au seul téléchargement des jeux…

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in France on September 16, 2022
Reviews.text:
Pris pour remplacer une RX480 8Go qui accusait l'age.

Cette RTX 2060 OC permet de jouer de manière fluide aux jeux un peu récents comme STRAY ou Granblue Fantasy Versus de manière parfaitement fluide. par contre elle soufle un peu en chauffe. Les 6 Go de RAM sont un peu juste mais pour une carte obtenu à moins de 250€ pendant la crise des carte graphique, elle était un excelent rapport qualité prix.

Par contre, je ne conseille pas de mettre plus dedans

I am very pleased with it as I'm building a med range pc and this card fits what was needed. It will play 1080p high/medium settings easily and over 60fps. I'm not a fan of the small RGB down the centre of card but you can turn it off with Asus Amory software if I needed to. The card has been faultless so far and I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.title: If you like constant tinkering pick this card.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2019
Reviews.text: the value for money rating is good, 130$ for a "mid level" card is not bad, I bought 2 of these to build two entry level gaming rigs but BE AWARE the drivers cause some major issues. I am using windows 10 and have had some major issues. I used DDU to reapply the drivers, uninstalled the drivers from safe mode and stopped them from updating with windows update, I get diamond artifacting randomly which sometimes results in BSOD on boot up (after windows login) and black flashes of the screen under near 0 load on the gpu. The gigabyte fan controller and UI for this card is absolute trash, I ran Furmark at 1440p through the DP to a msi optix mag322cqrv and the card got to 90 C within seconds and the fans NEVER CAME ON for the entire test, I installed MSI afterburner and setup a decent fan curve, and yes it'll get loud when gaming, or the GPU is under load, but that's what it is supposed to do. Even after messing with the drivers and the fan controller to finally get it to where it wasn't overheating constantly I still have black screen flashes , green screen flashes and the artifacting has seemed to disappear, i am currently running the v19.1.1 drivers but the amd utility is telling me to "upgrade" the drivers to the v18.12.2 windows 7 driver, makes no sense. (let me make note that all options have been tried, monitor, DP cable, and different video card) everything works fine, its this piece of hardware that is the issue. seeing all the same issues on both build that have been completed with this card. i switched DP outputs and they also have the same issue, the only way i was able to resolve any of these issues was using the HDMI out and keeping the resolution downgraded to 1080p. If you like constant tinkering pick this card.

Reviews.title: little expensive seeing that the 580 and 590 8GB IS ONLY 50 TO $60.00 MORE
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2019
Reviews.text:
I LIKE THE RGB STUFF but it didn't help me because you can't see inside case unless i open the side. Anyway this unit gave me no love for some reason when hooked to my AV receiver with HDMI the ARC communication from TV to receiver stopped, would not work. I unplug the HDMI from my computer then my ARC WORKED PERFECTLY. I used the display port with an adapter from computer to HDMI input on my receiver, using the display port solved the ARC issue but picture is not as nice as the HDMI.
i a long phone call with gigabyte they were not very helpful they suggested call Amazon an have it replaced. new one coming tomorrow lets see if a new one performs correctly. i is a great looking board very basic with cool lights.

Reviews.title: Questionable hardware quality
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2018
Reviews.text:
Ever since installing this card my computer has:
- randomly rebooted
- locked up when coming out of sleep
- blue screen of death out of nowhere
- "your graphics driver stopped responding" from the AMD systray utlility
- had occasional artifacting and visual corruption in games

Also the fans on the card seem to be tuned for low sound rather than good cooling. I tried Gigabyes fan utility which sucked, then AMD's generic Overdrive utility which caused my computer to BSOD on startup and required me to disable and remove it from safe mode. Finally I went back to MSI's Afterburner program to control the fans and keep this card under 70C in games.

I'm careful about static electricity when installing the hardware and I've tried several different drivers including the ones that came on the CD. I'm currently using AMD's Radeon driver 18.11.2. I think my problems are just due to crappy hardware. I normally use Asus, MSI, or XFX brand video cards with no trouble at all.

The rest of my system is an Asus TUF X470-Plus mainboard and Ryzen R5 2600. I had no trouble with my previous older Radeon card in this system.

Most of Gigabyte's software seems to be garbage in my opinion, but it seems to be the case for their competitors as well. For OC settings and such, I would recommend using Wattman, which can be found with the AMD drivers. I highly recommend this GPU, just not the Gigabyte software for it.

data.label: Epic IT Service - AMD Radeon R5 340X 2GB GDDR3 with DP/DVI (Full Size Bracket, for Normal / Full Size Computer only), Supports 4K via DP Connection
data.description: The Radeon R5 340X OEM launched on May 5th, 2015. Built on the 28 nm process, and based on the Oland graphics processor, The processor is a relatively small chip with a die area of only 77 mm² and 950 million transistors. It features 384 shading units, 24 texture mapping units, and 8 ROPs. This card has paired 2,048 MB DDR3 memory with the Radeon R5 340X OEM, which are connected using a 64-bit memory interface. The GPU is operating at a frequency of 900 MHz, memory is running at 1000 MHz. Being a single-slot card, the AMD Radeon R5 340X OEM does not require any additional power connector, its power draw is rated at 65 W maximum. Display outputs include: 1x DVI, 1x DisplayPort. Radeon R5 340X OEM is connected to the rest of the system using a PCI-Express 3.0 x8 interface. The card measures 145 mm in length, and features a single-slot cooling solution. This card is an entry level performance card, for light gaming only, not for hare core gaming, but it is a very good GPU for normal usage, like surfing internet, watching youtube, doing daily office work etc.

Reviews.title: Matching resolution to Display
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2018
Reviews.text: If your laptop or tower displays 1920 x 1080 (HD) and you HDMI cable the output to a HDef TV of the same res. the only diff in what you see will depend on the screen size. I.E. the larger the screen the larger is display. By going to a "4K" TV it will have 3480 x 2160 pixels which means all of your display will be in the upper left corner of the screen and there will be more space to the right and bottom for more windows you can open or hot have your windows overlapping or pilled on top of each other. The catch is you need a graphics card like this one that can output 3480 x 2160 res. Which also means you need a real computer, not a laptop. I recommend the smallest 4K TV you can get. I got a 43" on sale for about $300 which is really big to use as a monitor. Yes the HDMI plays thru the TV speakers. You might consider a curved screen because of the large width but the cost will go way up. This video card is small but works great. On the included disk you have to get the correct driver out of the correct folder. And since it does not output HDMI you will need an adapter.

Reviews.title: CAUTION: Gigabyte used to be great... not anymore. Take note if you have to RMA a card with Gigabyte
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2021
Reviews.text:
Card itself is fine. A little weird that they initially started selling this as one without the 6-pin pci-e and then for some reason switched it, with no notice, this card now requires 6-pin pci-e power, so be aware of this, even if you see comments stating that it doesn't. There are multiple models and it appears they are either getting mixed up, or have updated it. I believe it was updated to require the 6-pin.

I buy thousands of graphics cards for our small business building computers. Used to like Gigabyte. I had a graphics card fail shortly after purchase. Opened RMA with Gigabyte, everything good, sent it back. Waited for the notification they received it. The warranty site was completely broken, just error messages in Chinese no matter what I did. I just waited, thinking they are just busy, past RMA requests have taken over a week for them to mark it as received, so I figured no big deal. Well, when I finally gave up waiting and contact them, they said that they did not receive the card back and I should contact FedEx. FedEx said they were delivered correctly, and go back to them. Well, now what? Gigabyte is not answering, got hung up on, and not answering my support request. FedEx has been great, but they are standing by their claim that it was delivered to the correct address. I also use FedEx, and I 100% believe FedEx when they tell me it was delivered to the correct address, they have scans and able to show this. I don't know why Gigabyte would say they didn't receive it.

I don't know what happened with Gigabyte, until this year, I've had great success with this, but this is now the 2nd issue I've had with their RMA process, both in the last few months.

I caution anyone who is sending a card back to Gigabyte, watch the tracking, and as soon as it arrives, CALL them, e-mail them, do everything the day that it arrives to confirm that they received your package. Don't settle for an answer of wait and see, make sure they get to that package and see it, make it as received so you don't lose it all like I did. There is something seriously broken with the new process.

I will think long and hard before purchasing another Gigabyte card again.
